title: AJHS website
technologies: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery, Drupal, ColdFusion
description: Responsible for administration, maintenance and development of the American Jewish Historical Society website from 2008 to 2015.

imageTitle: Finding aid for the UJA-Federation of New York collection
title: United Jewish Appeal-Fed of NY Guide
description: Encoded the entire finding aid (guide) to the UJA-Federation of New York collection and created the folder-level database for the entire collection (2324.25 linear feet), linked to the finding aid. The project received the MARAC First Place Finding Aid Award in 2016.

title: BFI IA Strategy
description: Developed an information architecture (IA) strategy for the Buckminster Fuller Institute (BFI) site redesign as part of the final project for the "Information Architecture and Interaction Design" course at Pratt Institute, Spring 2009.

title: "Travel to Lake George" website
description: Developed for final project of "Advanced Web Design" course at Pratt Institute, Summer 2009. The site was created in Adobe Dreamweaver and uses a spry navigation scheme. I created a Flash slideshow for the homepage and reated a slideshow with Adobe Bridge for the Gallery page.

title: GadgetLibrary website
technologies: PHP and MySQL (WAMP Stack), HTML, CSS and JavaScript
description: Developed for final project of "Creating Interactive Websites with PHP" course at Pratt Institute, Spring 2010. I wanted to add the ability to add images to the MySQL relational database but couldn't quite figure it out due to time constraints.

title: Dalton Oral History Project website
technologies: Omeka Content Management System, ImageMagick, HTML and CSS
description: Developed for "Projects in Digital Archives" course at Pratt Institute, Spring 2010.
problem: The Dalton School needed a website for its 55 oral histories and reached out to the Digital Archives professor at Pratt Institute who agreed to take on the project.
solution: The Digital Archives class at Pratt Institute digitized the oral histories and placed the files and associated metadata into Omeka CMS and hosted the website on the Pratt website.

title: Digital Stamp Collection website
description: Developed for final project of "Management of Digital Content" course at Pratt Institute, Summer 2010 (archived by archive.org).
problem: There aren't that many personal stamp collections out there, so we decided to create one as part of our final project for our "Management of Digital Content" course.
solution: The Drupal site that we developed is for a personal digital stamp collection collected from 1993 to 1998 that consists of 161 stamps from 10 countries. Fifteen of the stamps are featured on the website including the ability to zoom in on the stamp image, sort by tags, collection slideshow and slideshow of the actual stamp album.

title: ContactWeb application
technologies: ASP.NET MVC 4, SQL Server, Entity Framework, C#, jQuery
description: Developed during the "Advanced ASP.NET" course (Fall 2011) and "ASP.NET MVC with SQL Server and Entity Framework" (Spring 2012) course at NYU SPS.

title: Skyscanner (Mini-Expedia) website
technologies: ASP.NET 4 (WebForms), C#, XML, Microsoft SQL Server and AJAX/jQuery
description: Developed as final project for ASP.NET Application Development Intensive at NYU, Spring 2011.

title: Basketball Facts ASP.NET Wizard project
description: Developed a wizard using ASP.NET WebForms wizard controls created for "ASP.NET Application Development Intensive" at NYU, March 2011. If not a member, the user has to sign up and then login to use the application. Once logged in, the user is able to start the wizard. Feedback is given during the quiz and a final score is calculated at the end.

title: David Chu's China Bistro website
description: Developed a basic website for the client, David Chu's China Bistro, for the Coursera "HTML, CSS and JavaScript" course, Summer 2016. The menu section is fully-functional and utilizes JSON and AJAX to dynamically display content.

title: Ristorante con Fusion website
technologies: MEAN stack with AngularJS, NodeJS, HTML, CSS and Bootstrap
description: Developed for the Coursera "Front-End JavaScript Frameworks: AngularJS" course, Summer 2016.

title: Ristorante con Fusion mobile app
technologies: AngularJS, NodeJS, MongoDB/Mongoose, Ionic Framework and Apache Cordova
description: Developed for the Coursera "Multiplatform Mobile Application Development with Web Technologies" course, Summer 2016.

title: AlbumFinder
technologies: AngularJS 1.4.8, Angular UI Grid 4.1.3, HTML5, CSS, JavaScript/jQuery and Bootstrap
description: Worked on a small side-project AlbumFinder that explored the Apple iTunes API. The grid provides the capability to save album data to an external .csv, .pdf, or .xls file.

title: Tour of Stylish Heroes
description: Developed "Tour of Stylish Heroes" at Angular Summit in Boston, September 2017. Features a dashboard with search capability and heroes view with ability to create or delete heroes.

title: People Project
description: Developed "People Project" at Angular Summit in Boston, September 2017. The project reads the metadata from a .csv file on the server, displays it on the front-end in a sortable table and uses custom Angular pipes.

imageTitle: Usability Study of the MEA and IGS
title: Usability Study of the MEA and IGS
description: Usability Study of the Media Ecology Association and the Institute of General Semantics created for the "Usability Leadership" course at Pratt Institute, Fall 2009.

title: NYC Archivisualizer
description: Design project proposal created for "Projects in Digital Archives" course at Pratt Institute, Spring 2010.

title: American Jewish Congress finding aid
description: Processed and encoded the finding aid to the American Jewish Congress collection at the AJHS in October 2011.

imageTitle: American Association for Ethiopian Jews (AAEJ) finding aid
title: AAEJ finding aid
description: Processed and encoded the finding aid to the Records of the American Association for Ethiopian Jews (AAEJ) at the AJHS in January 2012.

imageTitle: National Conference on Soviet Jewry (NCSJ) finding aid
title: NCSJ finding aid
description: Encoded the finding aid to the National Conference on Soviet Jewry (NCSJ) collection at the AJHS in March 2015.

imageTitle: National Jewish Welfare Board (NJWB) finding aid
title: NJWB finding aid
description: Created folder-level database and encoded the finding aid to the National Jewish Welfare Board (NJWB) records (1535.8 linear feet) at the AJHS in May 2007.

title: Cecilia Razovsky finding aid
description: Processed collection and encoded the finding aid to the Papers of Cecilia Razovsky at the American Jewish Historical Society (AJHS) in March 2006. This was one of the first finding aids I worked on at AJHS.

title: UJA-Federation of NY WordPress blog
description: Composed blog entries in WordPress from 2012 to 2015 and customized the WordPress theme for the UJA-Federation of NY collection project.

title: "The Federation City" Interactive Map
description: Worked on the database portion for the interactive map for the UJA-Federation of New York project.

title: UJA timeline
description: Added metadata to the timeline for the UJA-Federation of New York project using the Drupal CMS front-end.

title: ng-recipe-book
technologies: Angular 6 with NgRx and Firebase, HTML, CSS, Bootstrap
description: Developed a fully-functional Recipe Book app with Recipes and Shopping List modules using Angular 6 as final project for the "Angular 6 - The Complete Guide" course on Udemy. The app uses the NgRx library for state management and user authentication is achieved with Firebase on the backend. (Please note that the app was originally created in Angular 5 and previously deployed to AWS as shown in the above image and the app was then upgraded to Angular 6 in November 2018.)

title: Angular Messenger application
description: Developed a Messenger application that provides the ability to edit and delete messages with Message, Authentication and Error handling modules using the MEAN stack as final project for the "Angular (Angular 2+) & NodeJS - The MEAN Stack Guide" course on Udemy. The app is hosted on Heroku.

title: JS Accu-Weather App
description: Developed as final project of the "Accelerated JavaScript Training" bootcamp course on Udemy, which displays real-time weather condition and temperature in Fahrenheit for searched city name. I added city coordinates, humidity, windspeed and photo of the current condition. The app uses important JavaScript concepts such as DOM selectors and manipulation, AJAX with OpenWeatherMap API, working with JSON, and object-oriented programming.

title: New York City Subway System
description: Programmed a simulation of the NYC Subway System using the Bellman-Ford algorithm to compute shortest path(s) between any two stations. The project received the Best Individual Project Award in the Advanced Algorithms in C++ class at NYU, Fall 2000.
